what: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: avesperu package provides access --date comprehensive dataset Peru’s avian diversity. December 2, 2024, list includes 1,909 bird species, reflecting significant advancements taxonomy validation species records. updates based articles, photographs, sound recordings archived accredited institutions, follow classification endorsed South American Checklist Committee (SACC).

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: species dataset classified one following categories, reflecting status Peru: X (Resident): 1,542 species E (Endemic): 117 species NB (Migratory): 138 species V (Vagrant): 83 species (Introduced): 3 species EX (Extirpated): 0 species H (Hypothetical): 26 species results total 1,909 species, demonstrating Peru’s incredible avian richness. avesperu package designed streamline access data researchers, conservationists, bird enthusiasts alike, providing tools taxonomy validation species data retrieval using advanced fuzzy matching capabilities.  ’s enhanced analysis provided information, focusing trends implications Peru’s avian biodiversity: chart depicts steady increase number bird species recorded Peru 1968 2024, showcasing country’s remarkable progress avian taxonomy biodiversity documentation. decades, several key trends emerge:

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: species count grew substantially 1968 (1,491 species) 1980 (1,678 species), reflecting early efforts exploration classification. Post-2000, growth rate appears stable, key updates 2010, 2020, culminating 2024 1,909 species.

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: species belong “Resident” (X) category, accounting 1,542 species, 117 species classified endemic, showcasing Peru’s unique biodiversity. Hypothetical species (“H”) contribute 26 species, emphasizing importance continued validation efforts solidify inclusion list.

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: ’s quick example use avesperu package: package provides access list bird species recorded Peru also excels resolving potential typos variations species names fuzzy matching. ensures accurate retrieval intelligently recognizing accommodating slight discrepancies input names, making robust tool working diverse sometimes inconsistent datasets.
code: library(avesperu) #> This is avesperu 0.0.3  splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.05) #>         name_submitted        accepted_name    order_name    family_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius Falconiformes     Falconidae #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 3   Crypturellus sooui    Crypturellus soui  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 4  Thraupisa palamarum                 <NA>          <NA>           <NA> #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox Passeriformes Thamnophilidae #>       english_name        spanish_name    status dist #> 1 American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano Residente    0 #> 2    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra Residente    1 #> 3   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica Residente    1 #> 4             <NA>                <NA>      <NA> <NA> #> 5  Cocha Antshrike     Batará de Cocha Residente    0 splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.05) #> The following names are repeated in the 'splist': Thraupisa palamarum #>         name_submitted        accepted_name    order_name    family_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius Falconiformes     Falconidae #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 3   Crypturellus sooui    Crypturellus soui  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 4  Thraupisa palamarum                 <NA>          <NA>           <NA> #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox Passeriformes Thamnophilidae #>       english_name        spanish_name    status dist #> 1 American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano Residente    0 #> 2    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra Residente    1 #> 3   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica Residente    1 #> 4             <NA>                <NA>      <NA> <NA> #> 5  Cocha Antshrike     Batará de Cocha Residente    0

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: aves_peru_2023 dataset comprises tibble containing information regarding bird species documented Peru, sourced "List Birds Peru" compiled M. . Plenge 2023. encompasses various details, including scientific names, English names, Spanish names, order, family, status species.

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: tibble 1,892 rows 6 columns: scientific_name Scientific name bird species. english_name English common name bird species. spanish_name Spanish common name bird species. order order bird species belongs. family family bird species belongs. status Status bird species (e.g., resident, endémic, migratory, etc.).

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: dataset designed provide users comprehensive information avian species found Peru, documented M. . Plenge. organized easy access utilization within R environment.

title: aves_peru_2023 Dataset — aves_peru_2023
text: dataset based "List Birds Peru" M. . Plenge.

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: aves_peru_2024_v2 dataset provides updated tibble bird species recorded Peru, based latest taxonomic revisions South American Checklist Committee (SACC).

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: tibble 1,909 rows 6 columns: order_name Taxonomic order bird species belongs. family_name Taxonomic family bird species belongs. scientific_name Scientific name bird species. english_name English common name bird species. spanish_name Spanish common name bird species. status Category indicating species' status, based following codes: X - Resident species. E - Endemic species. NB - Migratory species. V - Vagrant species. - Introduced species. EX - Extirpated species. H - Hypothetical species.

title: aves_peru_2024_v2 Dataset — aves_peru_2024_v2
text: version incorporates significant taxonomic changes, new categories, updates derived recent publications, photographs, sound recordings archived accredited institutions. Total species: 1,909 Distribution status: X: 1,542 species E: 117 species NB: 138 species V: 83 species : 3 species EX: 0 species H: 26 species Species near Peru’s borders Ecuador, Colombia, Brazil, Chile included end list potential additions Peruvian bird inventory. updates reflect SACC's ongoing efforts evaluate recognize certain subspecies full species.

what: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
title: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
text: function searches bird species information dataset provided avesperu package, given list species names. supports approximate (fuzzy) matching handle typographical errors minor variations species names. function returns detailed information species, including taxonomic data, common names, status.

title: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
text: splist character vector containing names bird species search . Names can include minor variations typos. max_distance Numeric. maximum allowable distance fuzzy matching, can either proportion (0 < max_distance < 1) integer representing maximum number allowed differences. Defaults 0.1.

title: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
text: data frame following columns: name_submitted species name provided input. accepted_name closest matching species name dataset, NA match found. order_name taxonomic order species. family_name taxonomic family species. english_name common name species English. spanish_name common name species Spanish. status conservation status species. dist computed distance submitted name matched name.

title: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
text: function performs following steps: Validates input, ensuring splist character vector factor. Standardizes species names identifies duplicate entries list. unique species name, searches matches dataset using approximate string matching (agrep), customizable max_distance. Retrieves taxonomic common name data closest matching species. matches found species, corresponding row output contain NA values.

title: Search for Bird Species Data in the Birds of Peru Dataset — search_avesperu
code: # Example: Search for bird species in the dataset splist <- c("Falco sparverius", "Tinamus osgodi", "Crypturellus soui",             "Thraupis palmarum", "Thamnophilus praecox") search_avesperu(splist) #>         name_submitted        accepted_name    order_name    family_name #> 1     Falco sparverius     Falco sparverius Falconiformes     Falconidae #> 2       Tinamus osgodi      Tinamus osgoodi  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 3    Crypturellus soui    Crypturellus soui  Tinamiformes      Tinamidae #> 4    Thraupis palmarum    Thraupis palmarum    Passeridae     Thraupidae #> 5 Thamnophilus praecox Thamnophilus praecox Passeriformes Thamnophilidae #>       english_name        spanish_name    status dist #> 1 American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano Residente    0 #> 2    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra Residente    1 #> 3   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica Residente    0 #> 4     Palm Tanager Tangara de Palmeras Residente    0 #> 5  Cocha Antshrike     Batará de Cocha Residente    0
